poem:
**The Art of Catching Eyes**

Daniel, conductor of colors,  
paints whispers on paper wings.  
Once for guitar riffs, now  
for laughs and airwaves.  
Ink splashes in contest,  
with shrinking slices  
of peering attention.  
He knows the alchemy—  
to make stillness sing,  
to pull sight from the stream,  
to dance on kaleidoscope light.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Make your promo materials pop: creative people share their tips for eye-catching visuals Daniel England, 38, has been creating flyers, posters, artwork and zines since he was a teenager. In that time, technology and tougher competition for people’s attention". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
